Sentencas: An electrochemical model was developed to study the ammonia (NH3)-fed solid oxide fuel cells with proton-conducting electrolyte (SOFC-H) and oxygen ion-conducting electrolyte (SOFC-O).
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of ammonia-fed solid oxide fuel cells with different electrolytes

Sentencas: Different from previous thermodynamic analysis, the present study reveals that the actual performance of the NH3-fed SOFC-H is considerably lower than the SOFC-O, mainly due to higher ohmic overpotential of the SOFC-H electrolyte.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of ammonia-fed solid oxide fuel cells with different electrolytes

Sentencas: More analyses have been performed to study the separate overpotentials of the NH3-fed SOFC-H and SOFC-O. Compared with the NH3-fed SOFC-H, the SOFC-O has higher anode concentration overpotential and lower cathode concentration overpotential.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of ammonia-fed solid oxide fuel cells with different electrolytes

Sentencas: The effects of temperature and electrode porosity on concentration overpotentials have also been studied in order to identify possible methods for improvement of SOFC performance.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of ammonia-fed solid oxide fuel cells with different electrolytes

Sentencas: This study reveals that the use of different electrolytes not only causes different ion conduction characteristics at the electrolyte, but also significantly influences the concentration overpotentials at the electrodes.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of ammonia-fed solid oxide fuel cells with different electrolytes

Sentencas: The model developed in this article can be extended to 2D and 3D models for further design optimization.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of ammonia-fed solid oxide fuel cells with different electrolytes
